security: Disclosing the British Intelligence Service (MI-6) as the source of information on Levi Laub's travel to Cuba could jeopardize intelligence-sharing relationships.
summary: An FBI memo details information from the CIA regarding Levi Laub's unauthorized travel to Cuba, as reported by British Intelligence (MI-6) based on information from a British newspaperman, Gavin Young; the information is being directed to the Subversive Control Section.
summary_one_paragraph: This FBI memo, dated July 5, 1963, from S. J. Papich to D. J. Brennan, relays CIA-provided information concerning Levi Laub's unauthorized travel to Cuba between February 22 and March 11, 1963; this information was initially sourced from the British Intelligence Service (MI-6), which obtained it from Gavin Young, a British newspaperman who was in Cuba during the same period; MI-6 plans to make Young available for an interview with the Bureau; the information is directed to the Subversive Control Section for further action.
title: CIA LIAISON MATERIAL
